intro: Dimeria ornithopoda var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth dimeria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves that are covered in a smooth, waxy cuticle, which helps reduce water loss in its dry habitat. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species adapted to harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
